title: Behavior Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Texana Center (Rosenberg, TX) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions:
I was asked a few questions and shown scenarios on what to do in challenging situations. The interview went well and the manager I interviewed with was very nice. 

I got an offer but the HR department decided my perfectly valid diploma needed scrutinizing and were just searching for reasons to not give me work. I have never seen an employer waste so much resources to prove something they can infer from the two college transcripts, multiple diplomas from multiple stages of education and work history. It was pretty clear the HR person did not like how I looked and chose to scrutinize.

Overall, I didn't get the job. I do not recommend applying to this place.
Interview Questions: Why did you pick this job?

title: Service Interview
Interview Descriptions: Good questions and asked a lot. Decent Pat & seemed to really really need more staff. Person was very nice as well. It was a simple enough interview. They called back shortly for another interview and I was hired within the week.
Interview Questions: Whats a time where you had to work under a boss you didn’t like?

title: Youth QMHP-CS Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Texana Center (Sugar Land, TX) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the Youth program manager first and then came back for a second interview with the clinical manager. I would say both interviewers were really negative about the position, especially the second interviewer. Once I arrived before asking me any questions she immediately said "this job is really stressful and we have a high turnover rate." I was asked some questions about my past employment and general interview questions.  she let me know about all the challenges of the jobs and asked me how far away I lived and if I would want to take a long drive to get to the clinic everyday. I think she was just trying to feel me out to see if I was going to last but I almost feel like she was trying to convince me I didn't want to work there. At the end of the interview she let me know she would have to ask HR if I could work there because my college major wasn't a type of social science degree they've had before. Long story short HR emailed me that it didn't qualify.
Interview Questions: How do you like to be managed?

title: QMHP-CS Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texana Center (Wharton, TX)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very professional. The duties were described in detail and the interviewer was very informative regarding everything. He also gave me a timeline of when to expect a call and let me know that if i didn't receive a call by a certain day then that meant I didnt get the job. There was also an email sent to inform me that I didn't get the position.
Interview Questions: Most of the questions involved application of skills used to treat patients

title: Service Provider Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Texana Center (Rosenberg, TX)
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by two people. The questions were situational and written. The questions were based on job applying for. The  interview lasted about an hour. Offered postion within the week.
Interview Questions: Why do you feel you are a good candidate for this job?

title: Registered Behavior Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texana Center (Rosenberg, TX) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: You get to tour around and get a hands on experience before accepting the position which helps alot. You will be given the pen position for a while so that you can leave at any time and it wont effect you just in case you are not sure about the job. The turnover rate is very high so the job is not for everyone.
Interview Questions: What is the most difficult situation you have been in and how did you show leadership skills to solve it.

title: Houseparent Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texana Center (Richmond, TX) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: 10 min process anyone can get hired except felons.  It’s a face to face interview. About 5-10 questions will be asked along with a 5 question paper. After the interview about 3-5 days later you will be called in for a background check fingerprint and drug screen.
Interview Questions: Why do you feel you would be an asset to the company?

title: Crisis Center Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Texana Center (Rosenberg, TX) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Several ignorant unprofessional questions from staff, managers, and therapist. Other applicants were asked different questions by different staff.  The interview process was not impartial or uniformed. A negative experience like they were looking for a reason not to hire me or trying to find a reason not to give me the job.
Interview Questions: Do you have any medical problems, kids, or reasons that may cause you to miss work?

title: ABA Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Texana Center in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Great interview with testing of my skills, and current knowledge about the therapy provided at the clinic. There was a tour of the facility, and classrooms, and demonstrations and observations of therapy provided.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you’d what to work here?

title: Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Texana Center (Rosenberg, TX) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: There was a lot of questions dealing with ones work experience, interaction with disabled people, and a writing sample. The interview process truly depends on the manager and department. For example, GR is petty easy because the Team Leader does most of the talking. TxHmL the manger is very much by the book, therefore ask questions directly from the HR sample question booklet. HCS,Enrollment, and PASR is usually has a panel. FYI it you get offered a position with Enrollment or PASR the manager is very nice and the workload is not as much as the other departments.
Interview Questions: How would you explain people with disabilities to others?
